Their comeback was, however, tinged with sadness, because it was the first time they had performed without their brother Maurice.

He was RobinÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s twin and died in 2003, aged just 53, from complications following an operation to correct an intestinal blockage.

The surviving brothers were so grief-stricken that the Bee Gees temporarily disbanded. It has taken them until now to process both their personal pain and the effect it has had on their professional endeavours.

'It was awfully sad for us and itÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s still hard to believe. Barry and I had our different ways of dealing with it. Barry couldnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t face being a Bee Gee or making music. I respected that. It took a few years for us to break through that emotion.
